description: Middle French tanter (“to tempt, try, provoke”), variant of Old French tempter (“to try”). Doublet of tempt.

entries.meaning: A scornful or mocking remark; a jeer or mockery

verbs.description: taunt (third-person singular simple present taunts, present participle taunting, simple past and past participle taunted)

entries.meaning: to make fun of (someone); to goad (a person) into responding, often in an aggressive manner.

description: Compare Old French tant (“so great”), French tant (“so much”), Latin tantus (“of such size, so great, so much”). See ataunt.

adjectives.description: taunt (comparative more taunt, superlative most taunt)
